sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Daria Karpenko)
articles.description: Fintech products are systems that are overloaded by many types of data like numerals, texts, spreadsheets, and so on. Working with these products requires the designer to pay a high level of attention and responsibility, as he becomes a provider between user and data. Daria shares her approach to digital product typography and reviews the key points to consider when choosing typefaces.
articles.title: How To Choose Typefaces For Fintech Products: Our Best Practices Guide (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Slava Shestopalov)
articles.description: Working in the area of UX sometimes feels like a crime drama. Can’t believe it? Then look at these fun parallels between modern UX practices and a classical TV detective.
articles.title: Everything I Know About UX Research I First Learned From Lt. Columbo

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joas Pambou)
articles.description: Discuss the concept of large language models (LLMs) and how they are implemented with a set of data to develop an application. Joas compares a collection of no-code and low-code apps designed to help you get a feel for not only how the concept works but also to get a sense of what types of models are available to train AI on different skill sets.
articles.title: A High-Level Overview Of Large Language Model Concepts, Use Cases, And Tools

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: Discover how to incorporate a variety of media formats, such as images, videos, GIFs, SVGs, and so on, in a Gatsby website. Juan Rodriguez shares what he’s learned about optimizing files for improved performance after working with different plugins and techniques.
articles.title: Gatsby Headaches: Working With Media (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: Re-create a fancy hover effect where an avatar pops out of a starburst pattern for the frame on hover. The idea is to apply the concepts in a new context and gain another view of how trigonometric functions can influence the way we mask elements in CSS.
articles.title: Re-Creating The Pop-Out Hover Effect With Modern CSS (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: Geoff explores the often-overlooked divide between WordPress.org and WordPress.com, shedding light on the blurred lines between open-source ideals and commercial interests.
articles.title: The Problem With WordPress Is Positioning, Not Plugins

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: In this second article of a two-part series, Adrian shares insights about building WaterBear — his first project as a lead developer — discussing the challenges his team encountered while building it and various accessibility and performance improvements they’ve made. You’ll get a peek at the inner workings of a team striving to find its groove to systematize the work.
articles.title: WaterBear: Building A Free Platform For Impactful Documentaries (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: How about a little inspiration boost? Well, we might have something for you: desktop wallpapers created with love by artists and designers from across the globe. They are available in versions with and without a calendar for October and can be downloaded for free. Enjoy!
articles.title: Dancing Leaves And Spooky Fellows (October 2023 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: This article is all about experimenting with modern CSS features. We will combine things like CSS masks, CSS variables, trigonometric functions, `@property`, and more to create a neat hover effect that would have been extremely difficult to do even a few years ago without the latest and greatest that CSS has to offer.
articles.title: Re-Creating The Pop-Out Hover Effect With Modern CSS (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ganesh Dahal)
articles.description: In this article, Ganesh Dahal explains how the features have evolved since reusable blocks were officially released in WordPress 5.0 — and how the two have converged in WordPress 6.3 to form a powerful feature capable of allowing content creators to sync content and design patterns consistently in pages and posts.
articles.title: Exploring Enhanced Patterns In WordPress 6.3

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Scanlon)
articles.description: Branches are a really nice (and safe) way to configure or reconfigure your database without fear of screwing up the production database. Let’s take a closer look at how branching works with [Neon](https://neon.tech/), and the good news is, you probably already know how it works!
articles.title: Getting Started With Neon Branching

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: We’re talking about running grassroots conferences and meet-ups. What does it take to organize a small industry event for your community? Drew McLellan talks to WDC’s Alex Older to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 65 With Alex Older: How Do You Run A Grassroots Conference?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: Adrian’s kicking off a two-part series, sharing his journey as a lead developer. In the process, you will learn about the lessons and insights Adrian gained at work, including the strategies that went into the technical stack of the project and what it looks like to collaborate with a team he is leading for the first time.
articles.title: WaterBear: Building A Free Platform For Impactful Documentaries (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: With the new CSS `linear()` easing function on the horizon, the possibilities of what we can do to create natural-feeling animations and transitions in the future are greatly expanded. Jhey Tompkins looks at the current state of CSS easing in this article and demonstrates what we can expect from `linear()`, including handy tools to get your hands on it today.
articles.title: The Path To Awesome CSS Easing With The linear() Function

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ben Shih)
articles.description: To help ensure the success of a workshop, Ben Shih introduces the concept of an inclusive workshop. In Part 2 of the series, you will continue to delve deeper into several key principles and guidelines that you can follow during and after the workshop to encourage an inclusive atmosphere.
articles.title: Facilitating Inclusive Online Workshops (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: This article is a peek behind the curtain of how content is managed here at Smashing Magazine. In it, you’ll get a tour of an article’s full lifecycle, from a basic outline to the sort of thing you’re reading right this second.
articles.title: How Smashing Magazine Uses TinaCMS To Manage An Editorial Workflow

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: In the realm of databases, making the right decision about which system to adopt can make or break the fluidity and efficiency of your applications. PostgreSQL, an open-source relational database, has increasingly become the go-to choice for developers worldwide.  We just posted a full PostgreSQL course on the freeCodeCamp.org
articles.title: PostgreSQL Course for Beginners

articles.author: Eamonn Cottrell
articles.description: Did you know you can write Python code in a spreadsheet? You'd be surprised how many different ways there are to do things in Excel. Below, I'll show you 9 ways to add two or more numbers. You can skip to a certain section if you'd like to see that
articles.title: How to Add Numbers in Excel

articles.author: Nathanael Adam
articles.description: In this article you’ll learn about project-based learning – how to get started, how to get ideas for a project, and more. Tutorial hell is real, and it's a terrible place to be in. Project-based learning is the best way to grow as a developer. You’ve probably heard that piece
articles.title: How to Use Project-Based Learning to Become a Better Developer

articles.author: Joan Ayebola
articles.description: Forms are a fundamental part of web development, allowing users to input and submit data efficiently. Creating forms in HTML is a relatively straightforward process. In this article, we'll explore how to build basic forms using HTML , , and   elements. We'll also cover various input types such
articles.title: Forms in HTML – How to Build Basic Forms with HTML

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: JavaScript has consistently evolved, always pushing the boundaries of what developers thought possible. Now, entering the spotlight is Bun, a groundbreaking runtime that promises to take JavaScript speeds to unprecedented levels. We just published a Bun crash course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel. Haider Malik developed this course. Haider has
articles.title: Learn Bun, a faster Node.js alternative

articles.author: Sameer Shukla
articles.description: This article explores how you can improve your Java code quality using Pattern Matching and Sealed Classes.  Java Pattern Matching allows you to write more concise and readable code when working with complex data structures. It simplifies extracting data from data structures and performing operations on them.  Let's
articles.title: How to Write Better Java Code using Pattern Matching and Sealed Classes

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Web development has never been more exciting. The influx of new technologies and tools is reshaping the boundaries of what developers can create. At the epicenter of this transformation is the ability to integrate diverse systems seamlessly, creating powerful web applications. We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube
articles.title: Build and Deploy a Full Stack Notion Clone with Next.js, DALL-E, Vercel

articles.description: Are you looking to supercharge your web development skills? Do you want to harness the power of AI to streamline your workflow? If so, freeCodeCamp.org's YouTube channel has just the course for you! We just posted a course that will teach you how to use prompt engineering to improve your
articles.title: Prompt Engineering for Web Developers

I’m also a big fan of the Vue.js framework, and I’ve been building apps with it for three years. So it was a delightful surprise
articles.title: How to Build Stunning Animations with the Vue.js Transition API

articles.description: Web Storage is what the JavaScript API [https://codesweetly.com/application-programming-interface-api-explained]  browsers provide for storing data locally and securely within a user’s browser. Session and local storage are the two main types of web storage. They are similar to regular properties objects [https://codesweetly.com/javascript-properties-object], but they persist (do not disappear) when the webpage
articles.title: Web Storage Explained – How to Use localStorage and sessionStorage in JavaScript Projects

articles.author: Joan Ayebola
articles.description: Images are an essential part of web development, adding visual appeal and context to your web pages.  In HTML, you can easily incorporate images to enhance the user experience. This article will guide you through the basics of working with images in HTML and help you understand images in
articles.title: How to Work with Images in HTML – A Beginner's Guide

articles.author: Daniel Adetunji
articles.description: API stands for Application Programming Interface. The “I” in API is the key part that explains its purpose. The interface is what the software presents to other humans or programs, allowing them to interact with it.  A good analogy for an interface is a remote control. Imagine you have
articles.title: API Integration Patterns – The Difference between REST, RPC, GraphQL, Polling, WebSockets and WebHooks

articles.author: Saheed Oladele
articles.description: The React team no longer recommends using create-react-app (CRA) [https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app] as a bundler to create a new React application. The team and community realized that even though CRA was a jump-starter, it lacked the flexibility needed to configure or manage large and complex applications. Nowadays, the team recommends using production-grade
articles.title: How to Migrate from create-react-app to Vite using Jest and Browserslist

articles.author: Jaja Ibifubara David
articles.description: For years, URLs have been synonymous with web navigation. But the tide is turning, especially with the emergence of single-page applications. In the React universe, URLs are stepping up to play a pivotal role in state management. This article will guide you through the transformative journey of URLs as state
articles.title: How to Use URLs for State Management in React

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: The rapid ascent of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) into mainstream technology and its influence on various sectors of our society raises a series of profound ethical questions. It's not just about the technical ability of these systems but the ethical implications that could shape our future.
articles.title: The Ethics of AI and ML

articles.author: Casmir Onyekani
articles.description: Imagine putting in a ton of work to build a web application. And then it works in the Chrome browser, but misbehaves in Mozilla, Safari, or any other browser. As a web developer, you're likely eager to create amazing web applications that reach users across the globe. But one major
articles.title: Cross-Browser Compatibility Testing – Best Practices for Web Developers

articles.description: Getting a user’s location can be a bit of hassle. Over the years, the permissions required to do this and the logic associated with it have changed quite drastically.  If your application depends on getting the user’s location, you want to ensure that the user has a good experience
articles.title: How to Request Location Permissions in Jetpack Compose

articles.description: Imagine you're creating an article with a list of recommendations or a web page with a menu of options. How do you structure this information to make it visually appealing and easy to navigate?  This is where HTML lists come to the rescue. In this article, we'll dive into

articles.description: Modern software development workflows are complicated, involving many tools and dependencies.  When working in a team, it's not uncommon to use several different software programs, each with its own dependencies. articles.description: Have you watched a seasoned developer work in Visual Studio Code (VS Code) and wondered how they make it look so effortless? articles.description: Remote configurations are useful because they allow you to alter the behavior in your application without having to release a new version of the app. One prominent example is using remote configurations to decide if a feature should be turned on or off. That way, you can gradually roll it
articles.title: What is Firebase Remote Config?

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Whether you're a seasoned developer or just starting your journey in the world of web development, keeping up with the latest tools and frameworks is essential. And you can learn about two popular web dev tools in the new course we just posted on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel. In this
articles.title: Learn SvelteKit and Tailwind CSS by Building a Web Portfolio

articles.description: As a web developer, an optimized LinkedIn profile can bring numerous opportunities directly to you. After implementing invaluable optimization advice from industry experts who reviewed my profile, I now receive a steady flow of enticing prospects in my inbox! In this article, I'll share the insights I've gained to help
articles.title: LinkedIn Profile Optimization – A Web Developer's Guide to Attract Opportunity

articles.description: The journey to becoming a successful open-source contributor can be intimidating, frustrating, or confusing depending on your level of confidence, commitment, and expertise. I have had my fair share of all sides of the emotions that come with contributing to open source in the one and a half years (at
articles.title: A Guide to a Successful Open Source Journey – Lessons from Real-Life Experience

articles.description: In today's tech landscape, integrating AI is no longer a luxury – it's a necessity.  AI-driven applications have the potential to transform user experiences, automate complex tasks, and unlock new realms of possibilities. Understanding and leveraging AI APIs is a pivotal skill for developers looking to stay at the
articles.title: How to Integrate AI into Your Serverless App With Amazon Bedrock

And to do that effectively, React provides ways for components to manage their lifecycles.  This means that components can perform specific tasks at different stages of their existence, from the moment they are created to the point they are removed
articles.title: React Lifecycle Methods and Hooks – a Beginner's Guide

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: API security is important for everyone, but especially if you are dealing with payment information. We just posted a crash course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you about API security and how to address the pivotal PCI DSS 4.0 requirements. PCI DSS stands for Payment Card Industry
articles.title: API Security for PCI Compliance (DSS 4.0)

articles.description: One of the most common tasks that you'll have to perform in your programs is working with external resources. These resources can be files on your computer's storage or an open connection to third-party service on the internet. For the sake of simplicity, imagine a program that opens a file,
articles.title: What Are Context Managers in Python?

articles.description: Links are an essential part of the web because they connect web pages, documents, and resources across the internet.  In HTML (which is short for Hypertext Markup Language), links play a crucial role in creating a web of interconnected content, allowing users to navigate seamlessly between different web pages
articles.title: How to Create Links in HTML – Tutorial with Examples

articles.author: Manish Shivanandhan
articles.title: From Text to Meaning: How Computers Understand Language

articles.title: How to Build an Image Search App Using React – An In-Depth Tutorial

Lynn grew up in Shenzhen, China – the computer hardware capital of the world. Both of her parents were engineers. And from an
articles.title: Podcast: Game Development and AI with Lynn Zheng

articles.description: Astro is rapidly emerging as a go-to choice for developers looking to build fast, content-focused websites. Whether you're crafting landing pages, informative blogs, or intricate technical documentation, Astro offers a comprehensive suite of tools to make the process seamless. We just posted an Astro crash course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube
articles.title: Learn the Astro Web Framework

articles.description: Welcome! In a global world where information is available to everyone in just a few clicks, adapting your website and resources to other languages and cultures is essential to succeed. This book will teach you the fundamentals of localization and how to translate your website to reach a global community
articles.title: The Localization Handbook – How to Translate Your Website Into Different World Languages [Full Book]

articles.description: Large language models have revolutionized the realm of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and have opened the doors for numerous applications in the tech world. But integrating and deploying these models to design powerful applications often demands a specialized set of tools and understanding. Enter LangChain: a game-changing framework tailored for
articles.title: Learn LangChain for LLM Development

articles.description: Hey there! Ready to build something cool? In this tutorial, we're going to create a full stack notes app using React, Node.js, and PostgreSQL.  We'll start from scratch and end up with a fully functioning app where you can create, edit, and delete notes. Plus, we're adding validation on
articles.title: Full Stack Project Tutorial – Create A Notes App Using React and Node.js

articles.description: Hacktoberfest is a month-long event that promotes open-source contributions, collaboration, and projects.  Participating in this event as either a project maintainer or a contributor gives new perspectives to either your project or your career. You also get to meet fun people. This article will walk you through how to
articles.title: A Project Maintainer's Guide to Hacktoberfest

articles.description: Terraform is a popular Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tool that allows users to define and manage cloud infrastructure in a declarative way.  However, like any tool, Terraform can introduce security risks if not used properly. In this article, we will explore the most common security risks when using Terraform, the
articles.title: Terraform Security Best Practices

The video is an 11 minute watch): I love watching these types
articles.title: Self-Taught Developer's Fastest Path to a Developer Job

We just posted a full course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you the basics of Java programming. Alex Dobinca Cristian developed
articles.title: Learn the Basics of Java Programming

articles.title: An Overview of Prismane  – An Open-Source React UI Library

articles.description: It is easier than ever to launch your own Software as a Service (SaaS) company! (The hard part is getting people interested in it).
